utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, you guys ready to order?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Uh..

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, Priya?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Uh, I’ll have the Shepherd’s Pie. You want to split that with me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, no, he doesn’t.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, you have milk in the taters, milk in the gravy, parmesan crust. Your lactose-intolerant boyfriend will turn into a gas-filled Macy’s Day balloon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not quite accurate. The Macy’s balloons are filled with helium, whereas Leonard produces copious amounts of methane.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, no, on the Shepherd’s Pie. Can we move on?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, a little tip: he says he can eat frozen yoghurt. Do not believe it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sea bass. I’ll have the sea bass.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You gotta like this, the girlfriend and the ex-girlfriend bonding over your rooty-tooty stinky booty.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Kill me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It wouldn’help. The human body is capable of being flatulent for hours after death.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Guys, sorry I’m late. I have amazing news.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bernadette, before you change the subject, does anyone have any final comments on Leonard’s faulty digestive system?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, what’s your news, Bernadette?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: The thesis committee accepted my doctoral dissertation. I’m getting my PhD.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, so that means you’re a doctor, you’re a doctor, you’re a doctor, you’re a doctor, and Howard, you know a lot of doctors.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Congratulations, honey.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, Howard, tell us, how’s it feel knowing that when you two get married, you’ll be referred to as Mr. and Dr. Wolowitz?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Unless he takes Bernadette’s last name. And considering her advanced status, that could open some doors for him.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Please, this isn’t about me. I’m proud of you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, you’ll be really be proud of this. I was headhunted by a big pharmaceutical company. They’re gonna pay me a buttload of money!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Bernadette, that’s great. Howard, do you make a buttload?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Better than what you’ve got a buttload of.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, if I roll down the windows in the car, everything’s peachy. If you do it, you’re still not a doctor.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, just a heads-up on the car window deal. It helps, but everything is not peachy.

utterance.speaker: Raj (earphones in, singing)
utterance.content: Oh, if there was a problem, you can’t solve it, check out the hook while my DJ revolves it. Ice, Ice, baby. Ice, Ice, baby. .

utterance.speaker: Priya (off)
utterance.content: Oh, God, I feel ridiculous in this dress.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (off)
utterance.content: You look beautiful, Lieutenant Uhura. Now prepare for inspection.

utterance.speaker: Priya (off)
utterance.content: Shh, my brother’s going to hear you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (off)
utterance.content: Relax, he’s got headphones on. And we’re ten miles above Earth in a starship.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Really, ten miles? You’re orbiting inside the atmosphere? Moron.

utterance.speaker: Priya (off)
utterance.content: I can’t believe I’m wearing my brother’s Halloween costume.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (off)
utterance.content: I can’t believe you think he only wears it on Halloween. Open the landing bay doors, shuttle craft approaching.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Is that my future daughter-in-law, the doctor?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, Ma! It’s Raj!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: He’s a doctor too, right?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Like Leonard and the skinny weirdo!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, yes! Everybody’s a doctor but me!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Well, whose fault is that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Leonard’s putting disgusting memories in my memory foam mattress. Can I stay here tonight?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sure, but I’m going out with Bernadette. It’ll just be you and my mother.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I guess that’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ma, can Rajesh sleep over?!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Of course, he and I can play doctor!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: She’s kidding, right?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know, she’s pretty feisty since they put her on hormone-replacement therapy.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Paging Dr. Cutie Pie!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I must say, Amy, I was very impressed to see that Bernadette got her PhD.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s indeed admirable. Although, it is microbiology.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Your doctorate is in neurobiology. I fail to see the distinction.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’ll make it simple for you. I study the brain, the organ responsible for Beethoven’s Fifth Symphony. Bernadette studies yeast, the organism responsible for Michelob Lite. Is there something wrong with your neck?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s a little stiff. What a remarkably fragile structure to support such a valuable payload. Not unlike balancing a Faberge egg on a Pixie Stick.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Have you considered massage?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’d like to respond to that sarcastically. Yes, I relish the thought of a stranger covering my body with oil and rubbing it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I was proposing you massage your muscles with your own hands.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Still sounds like a lot of unnecessary touching.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Trust me. With your right hand, locate the spot where the scapula meets the acromion process.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Now push your third finger along the ridge of the shoulder blade, making a small rotation as you do so.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Rotating.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You should feel a small node-like object rolling back and forth along the bone.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You mean the myofascial point?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Obviously. Now bear down on it like the seventh grade noogies we all know too well.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, dear Lord, yes, yes, oh, yes! Amy, I’ve never been touched like this before! Oh! Oh, my hands are magic!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Don’t flatter yourself. Your hands are blunt tools guided by my knowledge of the nervous system. I could just as easily have paralyzed you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s someone at my door.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That doesn’t interest me. Goodbye.

utterance.speaker: Raj (at door)
utterance.content: Can I sleep here tonight?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Leonard’s having astronomically inaccurate Star Trek sex with my sister.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can see how that would be upsetting. Come in. I’ll get the sheets and blankets for the couch.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, don’t bother. I’ll just sleep in Leonard’s room.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I can’t authorize that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, he’s in my bed. Why can’t I be in his?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The Hammurabic Code is an eye for an eye, not a bed for a bed.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on, dude, I’m exhausted, and Tyra Banks says the most important item in your makeup bag is a good night’s sleep.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. This is a form indemnifying me from your use of Leonard’s bedroom. Sign here, indicating that I tried to stop you and did so using a stern facial expression.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Good night, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. Not yet. We still have to go over safety procedures. Now, the apartment has three emergency exits located here, here, and here. In the event of a power outage, luminous paint will guide you to the nearest exit.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I never kid about safety.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I was sleeping.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: In my bed?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I would’ve slept in my own bed, but it was being used to bring shame to my family. And the memory of Gene Roddenberry.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, you heard?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Scotty, I need more power.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry. Does Sheldon know you’re sleeping in here?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you kidding? He made me sign a waiver, participate in an emergency fire drill and take a refresher course in CPR. Thank God he had a dummy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Mouth-to-Mouth Mona. You know, she used to date Howard?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, my God, she’s that Mona? Why can’t you and my sister spend your nights here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We tried. She doesn’t get along with Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sheldon doesn’t get along with Sheldon. It’s still no reason for me to have to listen to you arm your photon torpedoes every night.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, well, how about this. Until Priya gets her own place, you stay here and I’ll stay at your apartment.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Can I bring girls here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You? Sure. Bring as many as you want.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, deal.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just not against their will.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do you really think you should be eating that cake?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If you’re gonna be a trophy husband for a rich wife, you might want to watch your waistline.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He’s right. A minute on the lips, a lifetime on the hips.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, ha-ha. First of all, I’m not threatened by my fiancée’s success. I’m proud of her. And secondly, I have my own career.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Until you have kids.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good news, Raj. I got the blood work back from the lab. You’re okay to stay for a while.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: When did you take my blood?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not important. Your sugar was a little high. I’d follow up with your regular physician. In the meantime, I have some paperwork here for you to go over.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What the hell is this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Boilerplate stuff. A modified roommate agreement for a temporary house guest. And a living will and durable power of attorney.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: This says you can make end of life decisions for me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: As your friend, let’s hope it doesn’t come to that. Please sign.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Did you sign this?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There’s a reciprocity clause. You get to pull the plug on him, too.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, that seems fair.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Congratulations and welcome temporarily aboard. Here’s your I.D. Card, your key and your lapel pin. Which Leonard was too cool to wear. FYI, part of your responsibilities as roommate pro tem will be to drive me to and from work, the comic book store, the barbershop and the park for one hour every other Sunday for fresh air.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Bring a ball or a Frisbee, you know, something he can chase.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Also, you’re tasked with bringing home all takeout dinners. Tonight is Thai food. You’ll find the standard order in appendix B or downloadable from my FTP server. If you have any questions, here’s the FAQ sheet, or if you prefer the human touch, I do a live web chat called Apartment Talk on Tuesday nights.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No backsies.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sheldon, dinner!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What is this?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: This is the difference between eating and dining.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Remarkable. I’m just realizing how much Leonard’s been skating by all these years.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s not a big thing. Just think of me as a brown Martha Stewart.

utterance.speaker: Penny (at door)
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon, did you change your Wi-Fi password again?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, it’s “Penny, get your own Wi-Fi.” No spaces.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thanks. Wow! What’s with the fancy spread?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My new roommate is bending over backwards to ingratiate himself to me. Uh, nice touch, by the way.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What do you mean, new roommate? What happened to Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The same thing that happened to Homo Erectus. He was replaced by a superior species.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m the new Homo in town. That came out wrong.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, let me try this again. Where’s Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He’s living at my place, so I’m living here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re living here provisionally. But I must say it’s looking good.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Woah, Leonard and Priya are living together? That’s big.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. Origami napkin swans, that’s the headline.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s a good thing.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So do you know what kind of research you’ll be doing at this pharmaceutical company?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, there are a couple of opportunities available, but I volunteered for the premature ejaculation project. I mean, it’s not like either one of us has heart disease. Oh, I almost forgot. I got you a little present.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, Bernie, no. You didn’t have to.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I wanted to. Come on, open it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You bought me a Rolex? How much did this cost?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, you let me worry about the money. I just want my baby to have pretty things.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: More wine?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, no. I’ve had way too much already.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Here’s an interesting fact about alcohol.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hit me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Man is not the only species that ferments fruit in order to become intoxicated. Can you guess what the other is? Hint, sometimes they pack the alcohol in their trunks.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Monkeys.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When does a monkey have a trunk?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: When a suitcase just won’t do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mmm, all right. It would appear as if alcohol is playing keep-away with your intelligence. Good night. Please note, it is now past ten p.m. Per our roommate agreement, kindly refrain from raucous laughter, clinking of glasses, and celebratory gunfire.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, explain something to me. You watch Leonard put up with that guy for years and years. What has to break inside your brain for you to think, Oh, Krishna, I’ve got to get me some of that?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, it’s a lot better than having to wear noise-cancelling headphones in my own apartment.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? Oh, God, yeah. Yeah. Leonard’s a noisy little dude in the sack.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Every night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? Even during allergy season, when he has to alternate between kissing and breathing?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s my sister. Can we not talk about this any more?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. Sorry, sorry. Can I tell you a secret?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I screwed up. Leonard’s a great guy. Never should have broken up with him.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, uh, to paraphrase Shakespeare, It’s better to have loved and lost than to stay home every night and download increasingly shameful pornography.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, you poor baby.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What’s wrong with me, Penny?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nothing, nothing. You know, if we weren’t friends, and you hadn’t brought up that creepy pornography story, I’d be on you like the speed of light squared on matter to make energy.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, you totally got that right! E equals M C squared.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I listen. I have no idea what it means, but I listen. To friendship.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: To friendship.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: Would you booze hounds please stop that infernal clinking? And the answer was elephant!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mmm. Mmm.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Leonard, sweetheart, we’re kissing, not eating hot soup.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Priya (computer tone)
utterance.content: That’s my parents on video chat. Go hide in the bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, come on! Why don’t we just tell them that we’re dating?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Oh, we’ve been through this. It’s not the time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: When is the time?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: I’ve got five brothers and sisters. One of them is bound to screw up real big, and then I’ll tell my parents about you. Now, shoo.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Hello, Mummy. Hello, Daddy.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: We heard there was a tornado in Kansas City. Is that close to you?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
utterance.content: Where is your brother?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Out with friends.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: I don’t like it, a young girl alone in an apartment.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
utterance.content: I’ll sleep so much better when you move back here next month.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re moving back to India?

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Who’s that?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
utterance.content: Oh, my God! There’s someone in your apartment. Call the police in America!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: When were you going to tell me about this?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Oh, hello, Leonard. What a pleasant surprise! Mummy, Daddy, you remember Rajesh’s friend Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: I thought you said Rajesh was out with his friends.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: He has many friends.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Rajesh has many friends?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
utterance.content: Why are you lying to us?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She’s lying because she doesn’t want you to know we’re dating.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Leonard!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, what difference does it make? If you’re moving back to India, we’re obviously breaking up.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: You know what? I don’t want to deal with this right now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So. Hot in India?

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Of course it is. It always is. It’s India. Now, what do you have to say for yourself?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh. That is a beautiful tapestry.

utterance.speaker: Penny (waking up)
utterance.content: Oh, God. Oh, God! Oh. Okay, look. This never happened. Do you understand me? Really? Still can’t talk to me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I said, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I live here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have paperwork that says differently.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Priya’s going back to India.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Irrelevant. Rajesh and I have a good thing going and you’re not going to ruin it. What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ve been up all night. I had a fight with Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She gave me a beautiful watch.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, do you understand this?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Talk to him.

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering room dishevelled, with a half naked Raj behind)
utterance.content: Damn.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. It’s, it’s not what it looks like.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What does it look like?
